titles.title: Telecommunications Network Security and Reliability Reporting Act of 1993
A bill to require the Federal Communications Commission to report annually to Congress regarding the security reliability of the Nation's telecommunications network.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S822-823)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

bill.summary: 1/27/1993--Introduced. Telecommunications Network Security and Reliability Reporting Act of 1993 - Directs the Federal Communications Commission to study and report annually to the Congress on security and reliability of the Nation's telecommunications network to: (1) identify the sources of its vulnerability to outrages; and (2) determine what default, redundancy, and recovery mechanisms are necessary to maintain and restore service.
